children.title: Is this inspection for a hospital?
Person at alarm-receiving facility before testing.
children.hint: Indicate person contacted at alarm receiving facility.  NFPA 2001 7.7.1.1 If the system is connected to an alarm receiving office, the alarm receiving office shall be notified that the fire system test is to be conducted and that an emergency response by the fire department or alarm station personnel is not desired.

children.title: Time alarm-receiving facility notified.
children.hint: Note time called prior to testing.

children.title: Building Management notified before testing.
children.hint: Indicate person contacted.  NFPA 2001 7.7.1.2  All personnel in areas that could be affected by the testing at the end user’s facility shall be notified that a test is to be conducted.

children.title: Time Building Management notified before testing.
children.hint: Indicate person contacted.

children.title: Building Occupants Notified before testing.
children.hint: Indicate person contacted.   NFPA 2001 7.7.1.2  All personnel in areas that could be affected by the testing at the end user’s facility shall be notified that a test is to be conducted.

children.title: Time Building Occupants notified.
children.hint: Note time called prior to testing.

children.title: Person at alarm-receiving facility after testing.
children.hint: Indicate person contacted at alarm receiving facility.  NFPA 2001 7.7.1.3  All personnel in areas that could be affected by the testing at the end user’s facility shall be instructed as to events that could occur during testing of the fire extinguishing system.

children.title: Time alarm-receiving facility notified after testing.
children.hint: Note time called after testing.

children.title: Building Management notified after testing.
children.hint: Indicate person contacted.   NFPA 2001 7.7.1.3  All personnel in areas that could be affected by the testing at the end user’s facility shall be instructed as to events that could occur during testing of the fire extinguishing system.

children.title: Time Building Management notified after testing.
children.hint: Note time called after testing.

children.title: Building Occupants notified after testing.
children.hint: Indicate person contacted.   NFPA 2001 7.7.1.3  All personnel in areas that could be affected by the testing at the end user’s facility shall be instructed as to events that could occur during testing of the fire extinguishing system.

children.title: Time Building Occupants notified after testing.
children.hint: Note time called after testing.

children.title: Date and Time system restored to normal operation.
children.hint: Date system restored to normal operation.

children.title: Occupancy classification, hazard & size of hazard area without changes since last inspection.
children.hint: NFPA 2001 protected equipment and/or hazard has not been changed or modified.  14.3.1(1)  Ensure there are no changes that affect equipment performance. Inspect for building modifications, occupancy changes, changes in environmental conditions, device location, physical obstructions, device orientation, physical damage, and degree of cleanliness.

children.title: Hazard area exit routes are clear.
children.hint: Provision of adequate aisleways and routes of exit and procedures to keep them clear at all times.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Warning and instruction signs in place.
children.hint: NFPA 2001 4.3.5.5 Warning and instruction signs at entrances to and inside protected areas shall be provided.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
As-Built Drawings On Site.
children.hint: NFPA 2001  5.1.2.4 An “as-built” instruction and maintenance manual that includes a full sequence of operations and a full set of drawings and calculations shall be maintained on site.

children.title: Enclosure without changes in barrier integrity.
children.hint: NFPA 2001  8.4.5 Enclosure Inspection.  8.4.5.1 The protected enclosure shall be inspected annually or monitored by a documented administrative program for changes in barrier integrity or enclosure dimensions.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Room temperature in fahrenheit.
children.hint: NFPA 2001  8.3.1 For halocarbon clean agents with a means of pressure indication, if a container shows a loss in agent quantity of more than 5 percent or a loss in pressure (adjusted for temperature) of more than 10 percent, it shall be refilled or replaced.   8.3.4  For inert gas clean agents, if a container shows a loss in pressure (adjusted for temperature) of more than 5 percent, it shall be refilled or replaced.

children.title: All hoses for this system without damage?
children.hint: NFPA 2001 8.4.4.1 All system hoses shall be examined annually for damage.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Discharge nozzles in proper orientation, mounting brackets securely fastened.
children.hint: NFPA 2001  7.4.7  The discharge nozzle shall be oriented in accordance with the nozzle listing.  7.4.8  If nozzle deflectors are installed, they shall be positioned per the equipment listing.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Piping joints, supports and discharge nozzles securely fastened.
children.hint: NFPA 2001  7.4.4 Piping joints, discharge nozzles, and piping supports shall be securely fastened to prevent unwanted vertical or lateral movement during discharge.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Disconnect switch installed and functions properly.
children.hint: NFPA 2001  4.3.6.1  To avoid unwanted discharge of an electrically actuated clean agent system, a supervised disconnect switch shall be provided.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Actuator last replacement date.
children.hint: Actuator replacement within date range? Answer as N/A if no replacement date.

children.title: Hydrostatic test for Hoses
children.hint: NFPA 2001  8.7.1  All hoses shall be tested or replaced every 5 years (hydrostatic test).

children.title: Overall system condition after test.
children.hint: Does the overall system pass or fail?

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
System returned to full operation.
children.hint: NFPA 2001  7.7.5.1 When functional testing is completed, the system shall be returned to its fully operational condition.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
System in service at arrival.
children.hint: Indicate if system was active prior to testing.

children.title: Lamps/LEDs function properly.
children.hint: NFPA 72  Table 14.4.3.2(2d)  Illuminate lamps and LEDs.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Ground fault detection connected?
children.hint: NFPA 72  Table 14.4.3.2(3)(c))  If the system has a ground detection feature, verify the occurrence of ground-fault indication whenever any installation conductor is grounded.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Disconnect switches operating properly.
children.hint: NFPA 72  Table 14.4.3.2(3b)  If control unit has disconnect or isolating switches, verify performance of intended function of each switch. Verify receipt of trouble signal when a supervised function is disconnected.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Secondary (standby) power supply
children.hint: NFPA 72  Table 14.4.3.2(7)  Disconnect all primary (main) power supplies and verify the occurrence of required trouble indication for loss of primary power. Measure or verify the system’s standby and alarm current demand and verify the ability of batteries to meet standby and alarm requirements using manufacturer’s data.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Power supply supervison operating properly.
children.hint: NFPA 72  Table 14.4.3.2(1(a)) Verify correct receipt of alarm, supervisory, and trouble signals (inputs); operation of evacuation signals and auxiliary functions (outputs); circuit supervision, including detection of open circuits and ground faults; and power supply supervision for detection of loss of ac power and disconnection of secondary batteries.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Batteries installed and operating properly.
children.hint: Ensure batteries are installed with connection tight and without damage.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Battery Type
children.hint: Enter battery type

children.title: Battery size
children.hint: Enter battery V/aH

children.title: Manufacture date
children.hint: Enter date of mfr of batteries

children.title: Serial #
children.hint: Enter date of mfr of batteries

children.title: Barcode
children.hint: Enter date of mfr of batteries

children.title: Visual Inspection
children.hint: NFPA 72 Table 14.3.1(9)  Inspect for corrosion or leakage. Verify tightness of connections. Verify marking of the month/year of manufacture (all types).

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Test results voltage #1
children.hint: NFPA 72  Table 14.4.3.2(9) With the batteries fully charged and connected to the charger, measure the voltage across the batteries with a voltmeter. Verify the voltage is 2.30 volts per cell ±0.02 volts at 77°F (25°C) or as specified by the equipment manufacturer.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Charger test - voltage - #1
children.hint: enter test results

children.title: Test results voltage #2
children.hint: NFPA 72  Table 14.4.3.2(9) With the batteries fully charged and connected to the charger, measure the voltage across the batteries with a voltmeter. Verify the voltage is 2.30 volts per cell ±0.02 volts at 77°F (25°C) or as specified by the equipment manufacturer.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Charger test - voltage - #2
children.hint: enter test results

children.title: Test results amp hours #1
children.hint: NFPA 72  Table 14.4.3.2(9)  With the battery charger disconnected, load test the batteries following the manufacturer’s recommendations. Verify the voltage level does not fall below the levels specified. Load testing can be by means of an artificial load equal to the full fire alarm load connected to the battery. Verify the battery does not fall below 2.05 volts per cell under load.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Load test - Amp hours #1
children.hint: enter test results

children.title: Test results amp hours #2
children.hint: NFPA 72  Table 14.4.3.2(9)  With the battery charger disconnected, load test the batteries following the manufacturer’s recommendations. Verify the voltage level does not fall below the levels specified. Load testing can be by means of an artificial load equal to the full fire alarm load connected to the battery. Verify the battery does not fall below 2.05 volts per cell under load.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Load test - Amp hours #2
children.hint: enter results

children.title: Gross Weight of Container
children.hint: 8.3.7 The following information shall be recorded on a tag attached to the container:  (4) Gross weight of the container ...t (halocarbon clean agents only)

children.title: Net Weight of Agent
children.hint: 8.3.7 The following information shall be recorded on a tag attached to the container:  (4) ... net weight of agent (halocarbon clean agents only)

children.title: Pressure
children.hint: 8.3.7 The following information shall be recorded on a tag attached to the container:  (5) Container pressure and temperature (halocarbon clean agents with a gauge and inert gas clean agents)

children.title: Agent Quantity within required limits.
children.hint: 8.3.1 For halocarbon clean agents with a means of pressure indication, if a container shows a loss in agent quantity of more than 5 percent or a loss in pressure (adjusted for temperature) of more than 10 percent, it shall be refilled or replaced.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Record tag attached to cylinder.
children.hint: 8.3.7  Record tag must be attached to cylinder

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
External visual inspection.
children.hint: 8.6.2  Containers continuously in service without discharging shall be given a complete external visual inspection every 5 years or more frequently if required.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Monitoring type
children.hint: Select type of communictor device

children.title: Type of communicator
children.hint: Select type of communictor device

children.title: Name of Central Station
children.hint: Enter name of Central Station

children.title: Account #
children.hint: Enter name of person spoken to or phone number called.

children.title: Contact person or phone number
children.hint: Enter name of person spoken to or phone number called.

children.title: Time test started
children.hint: Indicate what time test began.

children.title: Alarm signal received
children.hint: NFPA 72 26.2.2.1   For applications other than those addressed under the scope of 29.7.9.2, supervising station personnel shall attempt to verify alarm signals prior to reporting them to the communication center where all the following conditions exist:  (1) Alarm signal verification is required by the responsible fire department for a specific protected premises.

children.title: Alarm signal time (secs) to receive signal.
children.hint: The verification process does not take longer than 90 seconds from the time the alarm signal is received at the supervising station until the time that retransmission of the verified alarm signal is initiated.

children.title: Alarm restoral time.
children.hint: NFPA 72 26.2.2.1   For applications other than those addressed under the scope of 29.7.9.2, supervising station personnel shall attempt to verify alarm signals prior to reporting them to the communication center where all the following conditions exist:   (4) The verification process does not take longer than 90 seconds from the time the alarm signal is received at the supervising station until the time that retransmission of the verified alarm signal is initiated.

children.title: Trouble signal received
children.hint: Alarm signal verification is required by the responsible fire department for a specific protected premises.

children.title: Trouble signal time (secs) to receive signal.
children.hint: NFPA 72 26.2.2.1   For applications other than those addressed under the scope of 29.7.9.2, supervising station personnel shall attempt to verify alarm signals prior to reporting them to the communication center where all the following conditions exist:   (4) The verification process does not take longer than 90 seconds from the time the alarm signal is received at the supervising station until the time that retransmission of the verified alarm signal is initiated.

children.title: Trouble restoral time.
children.hint: All supervising station fire alarm systems shall be programmed to report restoral signals to the supervising station of all alarm, supervisory, and trouble signals upon restoration of the activation.

children.title: Supervisory signal received
children.hint: Alarm signal verification is required by the responsible fire department for a specific protected premises.

children.title: Supervisory signal time (secs) to receive signal.
children.hint: The verification process does not take longer than 90 seconds from the time the alarm signal is received at the supervising station until the time that retransmission of the verified alarm signal is initiated.

children.title: Supervisory restoral time.
children.hint: All supervising station fire alarm systems shall be programmed to report restoral signals to the supervising station of all alarm, supervisory, and trouble signals upon restoration of the activation.

Visual Inspection
children.hint: NFPA 72  Table 14.3.1(17)  Verify that detector is rigidly mounted. Confirm that no penetrations in a return air duct exist in the vicinity of the detector. Confirm the detector is installed so as to sample the airstream at the proper location in the duct.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Functional Test
children.hint: NFPA 72 Table (17(g(1)))  Test smoke detectors in place to ensure smoke entry into the sensing chamber and an alarm response. Use smoke or a listed and labeled product acceptable to the manufacturer or in accordance with their published instructions. Other methods listed in the manufacturer’s published instructions that ensure smoke entry from the protected area, through the vents, into the sensing chamber can be used.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Sensitivity Test
children.hint: NFPA 72 Table 14.4.3.2(17(h))  Perform any of the following tests to ensure that each smoke detector is within its listed and marked sensitivity range:  (1) Calibrated test method  (2) Manufacturer’s calibrated sensitivity test instrument  (3) Listed control equipment arranged for the purpose  (4) Smoke detector/control unit arrangement whereby the detector causes  a signal at the control unit when its sensitivity is outside its listed sensitivity range   (5) Other calibrated sensitivity test method approved by the authority having jurisdiction.

children.hint: NFPA 72 Table (17(g(6)))  Test the detector by introducing smoke, other aerosol, or an optical filter into the beam path.

children.hint: NFPA 72 Table 14.4.3.2(17(h))  Perform any of the following tests to ensure that each smoke detector is within its listed and marked sensitivity range:  (1) Calibrated test method  (2) Manufacturer’s calibrated sensitivity test instrument  (3) Listed control equipment arranged for the purpose  (4) Smoke detector/control unit arrangement whereby the detector causes  a signal at the control unit when its sensitivity is outside its listed sensitivity range   (5) Other calibrated sensitivity test method approved by the authority having jurisdiction.

Audible Circuit - Functional Test   (Table 14.4.3.2(15(e))
children.hint: NFPA 72  Table 14.4.3.2(15e)) Operate required sensors in circuit. Verify sensors operate correctly.

Counting Zone Circuit - Functional Test   (Table 14.4.3.2(18(h))
children.hint: NFPA 72 Table 14.4.3.2(18))  Operate required sensors at a minimum of four locations in circuit. Verify correct sequence with both the first and second detector in alarm.

Cross Zone Detection Circuit - Functional Test  (Table 14.4.3.2(18(d)))
children.hint: NFPA 72 Table 14.4.2.2 (18d)) Operate one sensor or detector on each zone. Verify occurrence of correct sequence with operation of first zone and then with operation of second zone.

Visible Circuit - Functional Test  (Table 14.4.3.2(15(e)))

children.hint: Verify correct operation by removal of the fusible link and operation of the associated device. Lubricate any moving parts as necessary

children.hint: NFPA 2001  7.7.2.3  Each abort switch circuit shall be operated to verify that abort functions occur according to design specifications and that visual and audible supervisory signals are annunciated at the control panel.

Main Reserve Switch Installed properly, accessible and clearly identified

children.title: Comments
children.hint: Optional

children.title: The owner and/or designated representative acknowledges the responsibility of the operating condition of the component parts at the time of this inspection. It is agreed that the inspection service provided by the contractor as prescribed herein is limited to performing a visual inspection and/or routine testing, and any investigation or unscheduled testing, modification, maintenance, repair, etc., of the component parts is not included as part of the inspection work performed. It is further understood that all information contained herein is provided to the best of the knowledge of the party providing such information.
Technician License
children.hint: Add technician license, if multiples then separate by comma.
